body.p: provides support for editing XHTML files. includes XHTML catalogs and document templates to help you get started. You can also find a sample file in the /samples/xhtml folder.

The XHTML editing features include:
Source Editing - You can edit XHTML files in the Text editing mode (XML source editor) using all of its useful features.
Visual Editing - You can edit XHTML files in the visual Author editing mode using all of its authoring features.
Validation - Easily identify errors and their location with the XML validation features.
Content Completion - The Content Completion Assistant displays a list of context-sensitive proposals that are valid at the current cursor position. In Text mode, it can be manually activated with the shortcut, while in Author mode, it is activated by simply pressing Enter.
Import HTML as XHTML - includes support for importing HTML files as an XML document.
Remote Editing - has built-in support for editing documents that are stored on remote servers through FTP, SFTP, and WebDAV protocols, allowing you to edit XHTML pages from your web server.
Syntax Highlighting - XHTML documents with embedded CSS, JS, PHP, and JSP scripts are rendered with dedicated coloring schemes. To customize them, and go to Editor Syntax Highlight . Select and expand the XHTML section in the top pane and you can see the effects of your changes in the Preview pane.
Print Ready CSS Style - You can select +Print ready from the Styles toolbar drop-down menu to render XHTML documents with an alternate CSS style that displays the document in Author mode similar to how the document will look when printed.
